Cumberland Regional High School will be holding a series of workshops for incoming freshmen and new students to the District. Students will be issued their Chromebook for the year, taught how to log on and access their email, as well as how to access Microsoft Teams and our Student Information System, Genesis.

The sessions will be held on Monday, August 31st, Tuesday, September 1st, and Wednesday, September 2nd. Each day will have 3 sessions 9 a.m., 3 p.m. and 6 p.m. There will be 3 groups for each session. Due to social distancing rules and for the safety of everyone, each session will only have 20 spots, consisting of 1 student and 1 parent/guardian.

In order to attend, we are asking that you either call the school and reserve a spot with the attendance secretary, Mrs. Moorhouse, at 856-451-9400 X208 or email her at moorhouse@crhsd.org. Spots are filled on a first-come first-served basis. Students who are unable to attend one of the sessions will be able to watch a recorded version online later in the week. Chromebooks would then be handed out in the student’s first block class.

CRHS FFA officers recently partnered with the HopeLoft organization in Bridgeton on a community service project called “Sandwiches for the Hungry.” The officers put together 50 bagged lunches, including a sandwich, snack, and drink, to be distributed by HopeLoft to local residents. FFA officers also decorated the bags with inspiring quotes in order to brighten the day of those who received the lunches.

"In a time of high uncertainty, it was rewarding for all of us to know that this act would make a big difference in many people’s day," said CRHS FFA co-adviser Nicole Smith.

The Governor and Commissioner of Education have released guidelines for reopening schools in September. Part of that affords you the opportunity to have input on our procedures and practices as they relate to CRHS. We are looking for volunteers to participate in committees that will address the following areas:

Leadership and Learning
Conditions for Learning
Continuity of Learning
Policy and Funding

All of the committee work will be done through email and/or “Zoom”-style meetings. If you are interested in having a voice, please respond to me via email - price@crhsd.org. We will include as many as possible, but do not guarantee the opportunity to include everyone.

In addition, parents are encouraged to complete our survey, online at https://bit.ly/CRHSReopeningSurvey2020, to offer input regarding needs and concerns related to reopening school. Please take the time to complete the survey before the submission deadline of July 10.

Thank you for your patience and understanding as we work together through this challenging time.

Steven W. Price
Superintendent

Congratulations to Melissa Lowry, senior and Class of 2020 Valedictorian, who was awarded four plaques by the South Jersey Interscholastic Swim Association for her accomplishments throughout the year! She also received two financial scholarships for these awards to be used to further her education.

"I have been in education for 19 years and I have never met a more deserving individual than Melissa," said Rich Husted, CRHS head boys swim coach. "What she has done on the educational, athletic, and personal level may never walk our halls ever again."

Congratulations, Melissa!

Students can use Boosts to purchase:
Distance learning tools
Reliable internet service subscription
Supplies like printer or notebooks
Tutoring service or exam preps
Online courses or software licenses

Good afternoon, Cumberland Regional family.

As most of you know by now, Governor Murphy has mentioned that a statewide school closure is inevitable due to the threat of coronavirus. We want you to know we are prepared to continue providing educational and nutritional services, should we need to close our school. We will send messages to you regarding how to access school work and food services, and that information also will be posted on our website and social media feeds. Please know that we are not pleased to be anticipating a closure, but if we must close, we have a plan ready, and school will continue at home until we can re-open safely. Notification time for a closure could be less than 24 hours, so please be prepared just in case. Thank you for your patience in this uncertain time. We will stay in touch.

Thank you.

Steven W. Price, Superintendent

post_text: Congratulations to girls Winter Track student-athlete, Yabria Kearney who placed 5th at the South Jersey Sectional Championships in the shot put event. Her placement and throw of 32'11" qualified her for the State Championships being held at the Bennett Center in Toms River on Saturday, February 29. Good luck!! #crhscoltpride

post_text: Congratulations to the girls basketball team on their 50-33 win against Salem Tech last night on Senior Night. Cumberland Regional would also like to thank the Greenwich-Stow Creek and Myron L. Powell girls basketball teams for being part of this special night for our seniors. The middle school girls played hard and provided the fans with an exciting game as well with Greenwich-Stow Creek coming away with a 28-26 win. Great job to everyone involved in helping make this a special night for our seniors Chrisi Miletta, Alex Hitchner and Aniah Hitchens. #crhscoltpride

Congratulations to Carolece Henry and Totiana Miranda for their strong performance at the South Jersey Sectional Bowling Tournament at Laurel Lanes on Saturday, February 8.

Carolece won the individual title with a 3 game total of 636. She also received a silver medal for 2nd highest individual game with a score of 256.

Totiana earned a silver medal for her 3 game total of 623.

Both girls will be participating in the State Finals for individual bowlers to be held this Friday, February 14 at Bowlero in North Brunswick.
Great job girls and good luck Friday! #crhscoltpride
